snippet: The opposition accused Syrian military forces of massacring  60 civilians in an act of revenge during a campaign in the country’s south this week.
abstract: Antigovernment activists report that Syrian military forces have moved aggressively to retake territory lost to insurgency in country's south and have killed at least 60 citizens in town of Sanamayn in government-ordered atrocity motivated by revenge.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Alan Cowell from Paris. Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Liam Stack from New York.

lead_paragraph: The opposition accused Syrian military forces of massacring  60 civilians in an act of revenge during a campaign in the country’s south this week.

headline.seo: Syrian Government Accused of War Crimes
headline.main: Military in Syria Is Accused of Massacre
headline.print_headline: Military In Syria Is Accused Of Massacre
